value.title: Robotics company gets OK to charge money for self-driving services
value.excerpt: Robotics company Nuro on Wednesday received the first-ever permit to commercially deploy its self-driving vehicles in California, allowing the Silicon Valley firm to charge clients for its driverless delivery service.

value.title: Nuro R2 self-driving delivery cars receive California deployment permit
value.excerpt: The media frenzy around self-driving vehicles has mostly been drowned out by this year’s more pressing concerns. That said, the need for contactless ways to transport goods has actually become even more important exactly because of those concerns.

value.title: Malaysia approves first testing route for self-driving cars in Cyberjaya

value.title: Nuro acquires self-driving truck startup Ike
value.excerpt: Ike, a self-driving truck company, has been acquired for autonomous delivery vehicle startup Nuro for an undusclosed.

value.title: Tesla To Offer Full Self-Driving As A Subscription
value.excerpt: Tesla has confirmed that its full-self driving software suite will be offered to customers as a subscription. In recent months, the automaker’s Full-Self Driving beta has been rolled out to a number of customers for testing but Elon Musk does want to see this testing program grow.

value.title: Apple Said to Be Planning Self-Driving Electric Car

value.title: Ouster, maker of self-driving tech, agrees $1.9 billion deal to go public
